column2: This represents the authority the Earth King wields over his Kingdom, whether he be a mere puppet of the Dai Li or absolute ruler.
This represents the authority and status of the Fire Lord, who at different points in time may be a simple monarch and in others, a conqueror or even a tyrant.

The unity of the Earth Kingdom can range from totally dissolved to fully united. Certain events and decisions can unify or bring chaos to the Earth Kingdom. When the unity of the Kingdom gets too low, the Earth King's subjects may stop paying tribute.

The Army of the Earth Kingdom represents how well prepared the Earth Kingdom is to fight a total war. At the unprepared level, the Kingdom's defences are in disrepair while at higher levels, every ruler in the Earth Kingdom may reap the benefits of greater preparation.

The Industry of the Fire Nation represents how technologically advanced the Fire Nation is becoming. This can range from the establishment of factories, to founding new military commands like the Southern Raiders and to exploiting conquered lands.
This represents the current stage of the Fire Nation's growth, whether it be founding colonies on the Earth Kingdom's shores, to waging a total war to conquer the entire world.
The Earth King is a mere puppet of the Dai Li and is merely the symbolic leader of the Earth Kingdom.
The Dai Li may control the Royal Court, but the Earth King is looking to change the status quo.
The Earth King has reclaimed his rightful place as sovereign of the Earth Kingdom. Some power however, is still in the hands of the Royal Council and the Dai Li.
The Earth King has reclaimed his royal powers, and reduced the Dai Li to the servants they should be.
The Earth King now rules with absolute power, answering to no one but themselves.
This represents the current customs and traditions of the Air Nomads, as decided upon by their highest authority: the Elder Council.

The Air Nomads pursue a policy of isolationism, cutting off all unnecessary links between the Air Temples and the outside world. Harmonious within, this policy enables the Air Nomads to endure the storms engulfing the wider world.

The Air Nomads stay true to their ancient traditions of pacifism and non-violence. While not strictly forbidden, outsiders who do not adhere to Air Nomad custom are often not permitted within sight of the Air Temples.

The Air Nomads have taken a much more pragmatic approach, in answer to the aggression of outsiders. While staying true to most of their traditions, they are fully prepared to confront any and all intruders on Air Nomad territory.

The Air Nomads have abandoned their pacifistic ways due to the dire situation they face. Not only will they confront all intruders with full force, they will go to great lengths to strike first against any would be threats to the Air Temples.
Vassals may fight against enemies both within and without the realm so long as Realm Peace is not enforced.
column3: Les vassaux peuvent combattre leurs ennemis ï¿½ l'intï¿½rieur comme ï¿½ l'extï¿½rieur du pays tant que la paix dans le pays n'est pas dï¿½crï¿½tï¿½e.
column4: Vasallen kï¿½nnen gegen Feinde innerhalb und auï¿½erhalb des Reichs kï¿½mpfen, solange der Reichsfrieden nicht durchgesetzt wird.
column6: Vasallos pueden luchar contra enemigos tanto dentro como fuera del Reino, siempre y cuando no se imponga la Paz del Reino.

column2: Vassals are forbidden from declaring war on enemies within the realm, but may attack external enemies so long as Realm Peace is not enforced.
column3: Les vassaux ont l'interdiction de dï¿½clarer la guerre ï¿½ leurs ennemis ï¿½ l'intï¿½rieur du pays, mais peuvent attaquer leurs ennemis ï¿½ l'extï¿½rieur, tant que la paix dans le pays n'est pas dï¿½clarï¿½e.
column4: Vasallen dï¿½rfen Feinden innerhalb des Reichs nicht den Krieg erklï¿½ren, kï¿½nnen aber Feinde auï¿½erhalb des Reichs angreifen, solange der Reichsfrieden nicht durchgesetzt wird.
column6: Vasallos tienen prohibido declarar la guerra a enemigos dentro del Reino, pero pueden atacar a enemigos externos siempre y cuando no se haya impuesto la Paz del Reino.

column2: Vassals are forbidden from declaring war both within and without the realm.
column3: Les vassaux ont l'interdiction de dï¿½clarer la guerre, que ce soit ï¿½ des ennemis ï¿½ l'intï¿½rieur du pays ou ï¿½ l'extï¿½rieur.
column4: Vasallen dï¿½rfen Feinden weder innerhalb noch auï¿½erhalb des Reichs den Krieg erklï¿½ren.
column6: Vasallos tienen prohibido declarar la guerra tanto dentro como fuera del Reino.

column2: Air Nomad Law can only be changed by the Elder Council's decision.
Enables Reclamation CB for all Air Nomads, and allows Air Nihilist's to use the Seize Province CB.
Enables Reclamation CB and Seize Province CB for all Air Nomads, and allows  Air Nihilist's to use the Seize Duchy CB.
Enables Reclamation CB, Seize Duchy and Seize Province CB for all Air Nomads.

The Earth Kingdom is in tattered state, with all those not directly under the Earth King's rule no longer obligated to pay tax or even speak of allegiance to their King. While the Earth King cannot syphon tax from the territories or use Royal Authority against them, they can be conquered without cost.

All Territories in the Earth Kingdom will become independent.\nThe ruler of the Earth Kingdom may conquer de-jure Earth Kingdom land without penalty.\nRoyal Authority cannot be used to influence subjects.
The Earth Kingdom stretches further than any could hope to govern. As such, beyond the city of Ba Sing Se, the Earth King's subjects merely pay a token tax and give a pledge of their allegiance.

All subject Earth cultured rulers on de-jure Earth Kingdom land become tributaries of the Earth King and their lands Territories.\nThe Earth King may use Royal Authority to booster subject's opinion and carry out various special actions.
To progress, the Earth Kingdom must reform, rewriting the ancient laws to bring Ba Sing Se, and the many subjects who rule over the far flung regions of the Earth Kingdom, together.

All subject Earth cultured rulers on de-jure Earth Kingdom land become tributaries of the Earth King and their lands States.\nThe Earth King may use Royal Authority to diplomatically annex States and carry out various special actions.

The last barriers between the monarchy and absolute rule must be swept away for the Earth Kingdom to become the world's truly dominant power. Whomever sits on Ba Sing Se's throne should be worshipped above any Spirit.

This final reform will allow the ruler of the Earth Kingdom to restore Earth Monarchism and act as its leader. In addition, they may use Royal Authority to demand conversion of subjects to this new paradigm.

The Fire Lord is the ruler of the Fire Nation. While greatly powerful in their own right, the nobility still have much sway over the nation, and spiritual matters are exclusively the domain of the Fire Sages.
The Fire Lord has a greatly expanded power, discarding the opinion of nobles and sages to become a supreme authority and answerable to no one.
The Fire Lord has absolute authority under rule of law. Any dissent against that authority is high treason, punishable by death.
The title of Fire Lord is no more, replaced by the even greater label of Phoenix King, supreme ruler of the entire world.
The time has come to build up the Fire Nation's industry, both to improve her economy as well as create a suitable industrial base on which a war machine can be built.
The time has come to appreciate the many diverse skills the nation's forces possess by organising them into elite units.

The colonies will be an endless sink of resources unless their resources are put to proper use. The build up of industry in the colonies will help them become more self-sustainable and better yet, profitable.
If the Fire Nation is to remain the world's foremost military power, it must have the most advanced weapons.
Through research, it may be possible to field machines of war no one thought possible.
The Fire Nation is the greatest empire the world has ever seen, and the time has come to expand it. The Earth Kingdom is weak and fragmented, the perfect target for future expansion.
The time has come to settle colonists into our newly acquired territories, allowing our people room to grow even further.
The time will come where the Fire Nation must be ready to wage total war upon anybody who dares stand in the way of it's destiny.
We must strive to push the battlefield further and further from our borders, conquering key cities to further our expansion.
The time has come to achieve total victory and world domination.
The Earth King is no longer under Dai Li control.
The Earth King has control of the Dai Li and Royal Court.
The Earth King is an absolute monarch.
The Fire Lord is monarch of the Fire Nation.
The Fire Lord is supreme ruler of the Fire Nation.
The Fire Lord can imprison any traitor at will.
The Phoenix King's is the supreme ruler of the world.

column2: Spirituality represents the knowledge and regard one has for spiritual matters.
Honour represents the true strength of the individual.
Freedom represents the true strength of the individual.
Equality represents the true strength of the individual.
Civility represents the true strength of the individual.
For long as the tribe's remember, they have controlled the sand to survive the harshness of the dunes.
Firebending Dojo's can impart the basics of Firebending to the nation's youth
The Academies are institutions which can prepare more Firebenders for military service.
The Dojo's are institutions which can prepare more Earthbenders for military serivce.
The Academies are institutions which can prepare more Earthbenders for military serivce.
The Waterbending Masters are venerable wielders of the art of Waterbending and they can impart their wisdom on the younger generations.
While a Nomad is often travelling, the Monastery is the place that all Airbending Nomads call home.
This factory is dedicated to the production of Tundra Tanks, powerful weapons in the Fire Nation war machine.
Royal Guard of Ba Sing Se
Aztlan is the ancestral home of the dragons, and their last remaining safe haven. Protected by the last remnants of the Sun Warriors, a few surviving Dragons dwell within.

It is time we lend a helping hand to [Root.GetTitledFirstName], spending a great deal of capital and time to finally bring order to our vassal's territories. By helping others, we may help ourselves build a stronger, more stable realm.
This province is home to a vast industrial complex, manufacturing both goods for the economy and weapons for our armies.
This chemical plant allows us to mass manufacture useful mixtures, both to aid in other industries as well as provide plentiful medicine to the masses.
This agricultural plant can process raw produce into preserved foodstuffs, eliminating our reliance on yearly harvests and allowing us to supply food to our armies far from home.
This factory is dedicated to the manufacture of civilian goods, greatly pleasing the capitalists and nobility in our realm.
This factory is dedicated to the manufacture of luxury goods, all of course to be consumed by the upper classes of our realm.
This steelworks allows us to build stronger armour for our soldiers, and maybe even manufacture larger, heavy armoured war machines.
This weapons factory provides the weapons and gear needed to equip our army.
The production laboratory is dedicated to enhancing and improving upon our manufacturing and construction process.
The military laboratory is dedicated to enhancing our soldier's equipment and improving our ability to wage war.
The research laboratory is dedicated to theoretical research.
A talented Firebender, [GetFirstName] will likely be able to strike fear into anyone with [GetHerHis] abilities.
A powerful Earthbender, [GetFirstName] will likely carry on that power in our bloodline.
A brilliant Waterbending Master, [GetFirstName] is the pride of our tribe.
An Airbending Master, [GetFirstName] is worthy of carrying on our traditions.
